DOC.brief_summary: We have compared to types of surgery to assess which one leaves the smaller surgical defect.
DOC.brief_title: A Randomised Study Comparing Tissue Conservation in Conventional Versus Mohs' Surgery of Basal Cell Carcinoma
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with a clinical diagnosis of a nodular basal cell carcinoma of less than 1 centimetre and 1 centimetre away from eyes, nose and ears were either randomized to undergo Mohs Micrographic Surgery or standard surgical excision. After the tumour had been removed the defect was measured.
DOC.criteria: Subjects with a clinical diagnosis of a nodular basal cell carcinoma of less than 1 cm, 1 cm away from eye, nose or ears Subjects of less than 18 years of age Subjects unable to comply with instructions, Immunosuppressed subjects
